articles.title: Dramatic rescue at world championships after swimmer faints and sinks to bottom of pool - The Guardian
articles.description: The American artistic swimmer had to be rescued from the bottom of the pool by her coach after losing consciousness in the water

articles.author: Zavier Ong
articles.title: Forget big cap stocks. Bank of America's top small-and-mid cap stocks - CNBC
articles.description: Much of the market's focus has been on big-cap stocks, but BOA sees opportunity in small- and mid-cap stocks that could hedge against inflation and a recession.

articles.author: Leslie Josephs
articles.title: American Airlines to stop flying to four small cities, citing pilot shortage - CNBC
articles.description: American and other major airlines say they have had to cut some service due to a shortage of regional pilots.
articles.content:
American Airlines plans to drop service to four U.S. cities in September, including Dubuque, Iowa, which will lose scheduled commercial air service altogether.

articles.author: Alistair MacDonald, Bojan Pancevski and Drew Hinshaw
articles.title: Russia Hits Grain Terminals in Latest Attack on Ukraine’s Food Infrastructure - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Russian forces targeted at least two large North American-owned grain terminals in the port of Mykolaiv, as part of what Kyiv and Western governments say is a campaign to degrade Ukraine’s ability to export food.
articles.content:
• Attack on grain terminals deals another blow to Ukraines beleaguered food-export capabilities.
  • Crash of a drone allegedly controlled by Kyiv sparks fire at a large Russian refinery.

articles.title: Scientists observe longitudinal plasmonic field in nanocavity at subnano-scale - Phys.org
articles.description: A group of scientists working on surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) has made a nanoruler to provide insight into the longitudinal plasmonic fields in nanocavities, according to research published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society.
